verse.roman:
gṛhāṇa draviṇaṁ dattaṁ
mat-satra-pariśeṣitam
ity uktvāntarhito rudro
bhagavān dharma-vatsalaḥ

synonyms: gṛhāṇa—please take now; draviṇam—all the wealth; dattam—is given (to you by me); mat-satra-pariśeṣitam—the remnants of the sacrifice executed on my behalf; iti uktvā—after speaking like this; antarhitaḥ—disappeared; rudraḥ—Lord Śiva; bhagavān—the most powerful demigod; dharma-vatsalaḥ—adherent to the principles of religion.
translation: Lord Śiva said, "Now you may take all the wealth remaining from the sacrifice, for I give it to you." After saying this, Lord Śiva, who is most adherent to the religious principles, disappeared from that place.
